name: Dinner Tonight: Spicy Roasted Tomato and Pepper Sauce
description: [Photograph: Blake Royer] I'm always experimenting with new ideas when it comes to tomato-based pasta sauce, a seemingly inexhaustible genre of cooking. When summer is at its peak, I love to make this no-cook marinated sauce, basically a bruschetta topping...
recipeIngredient: 1/2 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes
1 pound curly shaped pasta, such as rotini or fusilli

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 3 tablespoons of the oil in a medium skillet, and cook the garlic and chili flakes over medium-low heat until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the tomato flesh and season with salt and pepper. Raise the heat to medium and cook until the sauce thickens, then blend or pass through a food mill.

Heat the remaining oil in a second skillet and add the peppers, allowing their smoky flavor to penetrate the oil, about 2-3 minutes over medium heat. Add the peppers and oil to the tomato sauce, and bring to a low simmer.
In the meantime, bring a pot of salty water to boil. Cook the pasta until al dente, reserving some pasta water. Toss with the sauce along with the butter, adding pasta water if the pasta is too dry.
